Summary Currently working as a Vendor Sales Manager at Google Ireland within the AdWords SMB organisation. Managing a workforce of 50 sales reps across 11 markets, my main focus is on the acquisition and retention of SMB e-commerce merchants for the Google Shopping platform.  
 
Prior to this I worked as a Digital Solution Specialist for the EMEA SMB Sales organisation. The work was primarily project based, with the aim of enabling the acquisition teams to better package Google's entire suite of advertising products according to business objectives. 
 
I also have five years experience as an AdWords Relationship Manager - working with a diverse portfolio of large agencies and clients within the Financial Services sector, advising on and implementing SEM, display, social and mobile marketing strategies. 
 
Specialities: Account Management, Relationship Management, Google AdWords campaign management, SEM consultancy, project management with a particular interest in training, learning and development. Summary Coming from a technical academic background and having worked as a developer, I was able to merge my technical skills with my sales skills throughout my career. 
 
After joining Google I’ve strengthen my sales acumen and skill set and I’m now a complete Business Consultant using my knowledge of online media combined with my communication skills and analytical abilities to shape how new and existing business grow. 
 
I try to influentiate how decisions are made, to understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of the customers and partners I work with. Experience Web Analytics Consultant Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Lisbon Area, Portugal I help organisations define their strategies for cross-platform digital analytics, develop their capabilities for measurement and reporting, derive insights from that data, and take actions to optimize digital platforms and marketing investments. 
 
I also help organisations understand consumer behavior on their digital assets and design measurement plans that align more closely to their business objectives, so they can focus on maximising profits. Summary After completing my bachelor’s degree in political science and French from Georgetown University, I joined Google’s then-nascent advertising sales team in Boston. There, as a Relationship Manager, I led a client team spanning two offices to grow a $XXm portfolio of 15 east coast digital agencies through new acquisitions and end-client upsells (same-store).  
 
In 2010, I moved to the Google UK direct sales team, where I was entrusted with C-level relationship management and ad revenue growth of some of the Europe’s largest, and most complex, multichannel travel brands. I conceived of and created new types of data analysis, which transformed the way that UK tour operators bought their online media (principally, search), resulting in $XXXk of additional revenue within just a 6 month period. Beyond changing old media-buying behaviours, I regularly presented compelling insights for many of my clients, which led to new approaches to their brand narrative, core product or audience. 
 
In 2013, I shifted from working on the marketing challenges of my clients to doing the same for Google. I led the brand development of Connected Classrooms, a new Google platform that brings educational experts to classrooms around the world via Hangouts. Finally, I initiated and led the overhaul of the 2014 Google Science Fair website for content, UX and design.  
 
Most recently, I joined the Google UK marketing team as a Product Marketing Manager for AdWords (small- and medium-sized businesses), focusing on lead generation and nurturing, new customer acquisition, onboarding and retention. My mission is to acquire, grow and delight new AdWords customers, and most importantly, to maximise their success. Summary I work since 14 years in the digital communication and new media sectors, both as sales manager and project leader. When I was 28, I had already worked for 3 years as product manager for the recruiting and training of the sales network at one of Italy’s most important editorial groups (DeAgostini). Even though such role would have granted me a series of “convenient and traditional” opportunities, in 2001 I decided to launch myself into the new media sector, which I deemed to be the best observation point at that moment: in such sector I would have been able to participate, as a protagonist, in the world’s development. 
 
Hence, I became part of a start‐up project (Nexta Media), where I spent 7 years. During such period, I became both shareholder and Board member of the project. Thanks to the experience accumulated in Nexta Media (sold one year ago to the Fiat Group), I faced as a pioneer the digital advertising market in Italy. After 7 years as an entrepreneur, I had again the possibility to follow my personal and professional objective: go where the trends are developed and where the visibility on what happens in the advertising sector was at top: Google. 
In Google until today, I have not only covered the market through the direct responsibility of the biggest media agencies at world level, but I have also developed and carried out (i) integration projects between online and offline, (ii) digital efficiency research on brand metrics, and (iii) presentation events never realised before in Italy. 
 
In the last 13 years, I have developed and maintained business relationships, and very often also friendships (considering my interpersonal approach), with the main direct clients, media and creative agencies, concessionaria and other institutions in the media world. 
 
Today I am a manager with a very deep knowledge about the communication in general, and the digital media in particular, with a proven capability of managing a team and challenging projects. Specialties:- Start up process 
- Sales management 
- Project management 
- Relationship Management 
- Communication strategy 
- Training & Coaching
